title: Davidvictorson
author: Davidvictorson
content: Our country dey in a very big soup like this because our President don write another letter give Senate make dem fit allow collect $800m loan from the World bank1. Why him need the loan? He talk say him wan use the loan take pay Nigerians wey no get money N5000 every month for the next 6 months. Shey una dey see this format.Back to my first comment. Why I talk say the country dey in a very big soup. See wetin director general, Debt Office of the Federation, Ben Akabueze talk about our nation’s high debt profile:QuoteOnce a country’s debt service ratio exceed 30 per cent, that country is in trouble and we are pushing towards 100 per cent and that tells you how much trouble we are in.Shey una don see am- Is this loan really necessary?- Why the man wan leave too much debt for him successor?- Wetin really be the real worth of N5000 per month for market as at today?- Who be the enemies of Nigeria wey dey give am this terrible advice?1. https://leadership.ng/president-muhammadu-buhari-seeks-senates-approval-for-fresh-800m-loan/#:~:text=President%20Muhammadu%20Buhari%20has%20written,the%20trend%20was%20becoming%20unsustainable.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on May 11, 2023, 04:56:47 PMOur country dey in a very big soup like this because our President don write another letter give Senate make dem fit allow collect $800m loan from the World bank1. Why him need the loan? He talk say him wan use the loan take pay Nigerians wey no get money N5000 every month for the next 6 months. Shey una dey see this format.Six months? for someone who is leaving office in less than two weeks? no be propaganda be this. I read about the loan move, but the reason for it was not properly communicated to the best of my knowledge. That being said, a $800 million loan for someone who is about to leave office sounds crazy, and I doubt the Senate would approve such a decision. There is often news about the country borrowing money. I've never read anything about them repaying outstanding loans. Enough of Buhari; the country is poised to change governments, and I hope the incoming administration is better than the current one.
